The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

Have a nice day! ğŸµ

that linked example solves for if your x-axis is of type "category", what about if your x-axis is of type "value" and your series data looks something like this? is it possible to create a step line chart w/o a "category" x-axis?

```js
xAxis : [
        {
            type : 'value',
            scale: true
        }
    ],
    yAxis : [
        {
            type : 'value',
            scale: true
        }
    ],
series: {
            type:'line',
            itemStyle: {normal: {areaStyle: {type: 'default'}}},
            data: [
                [90,45],
                [92,40],
                [94,25],
                [97,20],
                [98,17],
                [98.5,13],
                [99,4],
                [99.5, 1],
                [100,0],
                [100.5, 1],
                [101, 3],
                [102,5],
                [102.5, 8],
                [103,18],
                [104,23],
                [105,29],
                [107,34],
                [108,39]
            ]
        }
```
Thanks. Any idea on when the next release with recent fixes will be released?

@Ovilia 
I tried with a custom toolbox, with custom toolbox also it is not working. Actually, I want to add title on the image when we download it.  I have used setOption to set a title on the image. with setOption, it again set all the options and display the initial image. Please see the attachment.
1. The image named image_1.png is the image which is not expanded. On UI title is not available but in downloaded image title is present  i.e "Disk Usage" .
2. And the second one, image_2.png is the expanded image i.e when we click on any part image is more visible. 
    - Here I want to add the title and download this image. But when we clicked on the download button (in demo) it will add title but download the first image i.e "image_1.png". 
![Image_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52197143/60715994-f0011380-9f3b-11e9-8a50-03a90ab3c2f5.png)
![image_2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52197143/60715991-ef687d00-9f3b-11e9-863e-0aebcf514893.png)

@Ovilia 
Any update on this issue? Please reply...
@Ovilia what does stale mean? The issue is not fixed, it is easily reproducible, lots of people experiencing it... Why is this stale?

I'm afraid HTML mark-up is not possible, because it uses canvas to render the label. However, [rich](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#yAxis.axisLabel.rich) option provides a flexible way to control the content. Please check if it helps.

@Ovilia I've updated the fiddle. 

After trying to reproduce it there, I realized that it only seems to happens when you add the `type: time` to `xAxis`. The heatmap boxes then seem to overlap some of the axis labels as well. So I'm not sure right now if it's:
a) a bug, since `type: time` should technically work
b) a problem with the way I am passing the data in to the x axis. If so - please let me know and I can make a clarifying PR for the documentation :)
